definitions: senior administrative officer in a university or college faculty who oversees academic affairs
senior priest in a cathedral or collegiate church responsible for administration
examples: The dean of medicine announced new research funding initiatives
Students must get approval from the dean before changing majors
The cathedral dean presided over the Easter service magnificently
She was appointed dean after serving twenty years as canon

definitions: person who is loved or cherished by someone
polite form of address used in letters or speech
examples: My dear grandmother always made the best apple pie
She's such a dear for helping with the children
Dear colleagues, thank you for attending today's meeting
The letter began with Dear Sir or Madam

definitions: person who is most loved or cherished among all others
examples: My dearest friend stood by me through every hardship
She wrote to her dearest confidant about her troubles
Dearest mother, your wisdom guides me through life's challenges
He kept letters from his dearest companion for decades

definitions: severe shortage or absence of something that is needed or desired
examples: The dearth of qualified teachers affected rural schools severely
There's a troubling dearth of affordable housing in cities
The dearth of rainfall caused widespread crop failures this year
A dearth of evidence made the investigation difficult to pursue

definitions: permanent cessation of all biological functions that sustain a living organism
abstract representation of mortality as a figure or force in art and literature
examples: The death occurred peacefully in the early morning hours
Modern medicine has changed our understanding of death significantly
Death stalked the battlefield like a relentless shadow
In the painting, Death carries an hourglass and scythe

definitions: bed in which a person dies or spends their final moments of life
examples: She made peace with her family from her deathbed
His deathbed confession revealed long-hidden family secrets
The nurse attended to patients on their deathbeds with compassion
Many deathbed wishes involve reconciliation with estranged loved ones

definitions: young woman making her formal entrance into society at a special event
examples: The deb wore an elegant white gown to the ball
Several debs were presented at the charity gala last night
Her grandmother had been a deb in the 1950s society
The annual deb ball raises funds for local scholarships

definitions: sudden and complete failure or collapse of an undertaking or institution
examples: The product launch became a debacle when systems crashed nationwide
The military operation turned into a debacle with heavy casualties
The election debacle left the party in complete disarray
Financial experts called it the worst debacle in decades

definitions: structured discussion where opposing arguments are presented on a particular topic
serious discussion or argument about a subject involving many people
examples: The presidential debate attracted millions of television viewers nationwide
Our debate team won the regional championship this year
The debate over healthcare reform continues in Congress today
There's ongoing debate about the best teaching methods available

definitions: person who engages in formal debates or argues positions in structured discussions
examples: The skilled debater presented compelling evidence for her position
Championship debaters practice argumentation techniques for hours daily
He's a passionate debater on environmental policy issues
The debaters shook hands after their intense competition ended

definitions: excessive indulgence in sensual pleasures, especially drinking, drugs, and sexual activity
examples: The emperor's debauchery eventually led to his downfall
Tales of debauchery from the party shocked the community
Years of debauchery had taken their toll on his health
The novel depicts the debauchery of 1920s high society

definitions: accounting entry recording money owed or spent from an account
amount of money taken from a bank account or charged to it
examples: The accountant recorded each debit in the company ledger
Every debit must have a corresponding credit entry somewhere
The debit appeared on my bank statement this morning
Automatic debits pay my utility bills each month

definitions: questioning session to obtain information about a completed mission, project, or experience
examples: The pilot attended a debriefing after the reconnaissance mission
Police conducted a debriefing with all witnesses immediately
The project debriefing revealed several areas needing improvement
Psychological debriefing helps emergency workers process traumatic events

definitions: scattered pieces of waste, remains, or broken parts of something destroyed
examples: Construction debris filled several dumpsters outside the building
Storm debris blocked roads throughout the coastal region
Space debris poses increasing risks to satellites and spacecraft
Archaeological debris provides clues about ancient civilizations

definitions: sum of money that is owed or due to another party
feeling of gratitude or obligation for help or kindness received
examples: Student debt has reached crisis levels in many countries
The company struggled to pay its mounting debts
I owe you a debt of gratitude for your help
She felt a deep debt to her mentor's guidance

definitions: person or organization that owes money to another party
examples: The debtor failed to make payments for three consecutive months
Creditors pursued debtors through the court system aggressively
Many debtors struggle with multiple loan obligations simultaneously
The debtor nations negotiated for better repayment terms

definitions: computer program that helps find and fix errors in other programs or code
examples: The debugger showed exactly where the code was failing
Modern debuggers allow programmers to step through code line-by-line
She used the debugger to identify memory leaks efficiently
The integrated debugger made troubleshooting much faster yesterday

definitions: act of exposing false or exaggerated claims, myths, or pretensions as untrue
examples: The scientist spent years debunking pseudoscientific health claims
Her debunking of conspiracy theories went viral online
The article focused on debunking common investment myths
Debunking requires careful research and factual evidence

definitions: first public appearance or performance of a person, product, or artistic work
examples: The actress made her Broadway debut last Tuesday evening
The car manufacturer's electric vehicle debut exceeded expectations
Her debut novel became an instant bestseller worldwide
The band's debut album received critical acclaim immediately

definitions: young woman from an upper-class family making her formal entrance into society
examples: The debutante wore her grandmother's pearls to the ball
Several debutantes were presented at the annual charity gala
The debutante season traditionally begins in early summer
Her mother had been a debutante thirty years earlier

definitions: abbreviated form of December, the twelfth month of the year
examples: The meeting is scheduled for Dec 15th this year
Please submit your report by Dec 31st without fail
Dec temperatures dropped below freezing across the region
The Dec holiday rush begins earlier each year

definitions: period of ten consecutive years, especially one beginning with a year ending in zero
examples: The last decade saw unprecedented technological advancement worldwide
Housing prices doubled over the past decade significantly
Each decade brings new challenges and opportunities for growth
The decade of the 1960s transformed American society profoundly

definitions: state of moral or cultural decline characterized by excessive indulgence in pleasure or luxury
examples: The empire's decadence preceded its eventual collapse dramatically
Critics blamed societal decadence for increasing social problems
The novel explores themes of decadence in modern society
Artistic decadence marked the fin de siècle period

definitions: person who is characterized by or reflecting moral or cultural decline through self-indulgence
examples: The decadent aristocrat squandered his entire family fortune
Many decadents of the era wrote provocative literature
He lived as a decadent, pursuing only pleasure and luxury
The decadents rejected traditional Victorian moral values completely

definitions: design or picture that can be transferred from special paper onto another surface
examples: She applied vintage decals to her motorcycle helmet carefully
The company logo decal adorned every delivery truck
Window decals displayed the store's hours of operation
Custom decals personalized the laptop computer case beautifully

definitions: act of cutting off the head of a person or animal, especially as execution
examples: Historical accounts describe public decapitation as criminal punishment
The revolution ended with the king's decapitation by guillotine
Accidental decapitation can occur in severe vehicle accidents
Ancient civilizations practiced ritual decapitation in religious ceremonies

definitions: athletic contest consisting of ten different track and field events held over two days
examples: He trained for years to compete in the Olympic decathlon
The decathlon tests both speed and endurance comprehensively
Winning the decathlon requires mastery of diverse athletic skills
The decathlon champion is considered the world's greatest athlete

definitions: gradual process of rotting, decomposition, or declining in quality or strength
spontaneous transformation of unstable atomic nuclei resulting in radiation emission
examples: Tooth decay requires immediate dental treatment to prevent spreading
Urban decay left many buildings abandoned and deteriorating
Radioactive decay occurs at predictable rates for each isotope
Scientists measured the decay rate of the carbon-14 sample

definitions: person who has died, especially one who has died recently
examples: The deceased left his entire estate to charity
Family members identified the deceased at the morgue yesterday
The deceased had been a prominent community leader
Flowers were placed beside the deceased during the viewing

definitions: deceased person, especially one who has left property or estate to be distributed
examples: The decedent's will was read to assembled family members
Lawyers reviewed the decedent's financial records thoroughly
The decedent had no known living relatives anywhere
Property of the decedent must go through probate court

definitions: action or practice of deceiving someone by concealing or misrepresenting the truth
examples: His deceit destroyed years of trust between them
The company's deceit led to massive lawsuits nationwide
She couldn't forgive the deceit behind his actions
Political deceit undermines democratic institutions fundamentally

definitions: person who deliberately misleads or tricks others through lies or false pretenses
examples: The deceiver convinced dozens to invest in his scheme
History's greatest deceivers often appeared trustworthy initially
She exposed him as a deceiver and fraud publicly
The deceiver's web of lies eventually unraveled completely

definitions: process of slowing down or reducing speed, velocity, or rate of progress
examples: The car's sudden deceleration threw passengers forward violently
Economic deceleration worried investors and policy makers alike
Deceleration forces during landing stress aircraft structures significantly
The rocket's deceleration phase began after reaching orbit

definitions: behavior that conforms to accepted standards of morality, propriety, or good taste
examples: Common decency requires treating everyone with basic respect
She had the decency to apologize for her mistake
Public decency laws regulate behavior in shared spaces
His decency and integrity earned widespread admiration

definitions: transfer of authority and responsibility from central to local government or organization units
examples: Government decentralisation gave regions more autonomous decision-making power
The company's decentralisation improved local market responsiveness significantly
Educational decentralisation allowed schools greater curriculum flexibility
Decentralisation reduced bureaucratic delays in project approval processes

definitions: transfer of authority and responsibility from central to local government or organization units
examples: Corporate decentralization empowered regional managers to make decisions
Political decentralization strengthened local democratic institutions considerably
The decentralization plan redistributed resources to rural areas
Blockchain enables decentralization of financial systems globally

definitions: action of deceiving someone through deliberately making them believe something false
examples: The magician's deception amazed the entire audience completely
Military deception tactics confused enemy forces during battle
Her deception lasted months before the truth emerged
Consumer deception violates federal trade commission regulations

definitions: unit used to measure the intensity or loudness of sound on a logarithmic scale
examples: Concert noise levels exceeded 110 decibels near speakers
The decibel meter showed dangerous noise levels continuously
Normal conversation measures about sixty decibels typically
Each ten decibel increase represents doubled perceived loudness

definitions: process or act of making a choice or reaching a conclusion about something
examples: The deciding factor was the candidate's relevant experience
Deciding between colleges proved more difficult than expected
The jury spent hours deciding on the verdict
Price became the deciding element in their purchase

definitions: numerical system based on powers of ten using a decimal point
number expressed using a decimal point to show fractions of ten
examples: The decimal system revolutionized mathematical calculations worldwide
Computer systems convert binary to decimal for display
Round the decimal to two places for currency amounts
The decimal 3.14159 represents the value of pi

definitions: killing or destruction of a large proportion of a group or population
examples: Disease caused decimation of indigenous populations historically
The hurricane's decimation left entire communities homeless
Wildlife decimation threatens ecosystem balance globally
Economic decimation followed the market crash immediately

definitions: process of discovering the meaning of something written in code or unclear writing
examples: The decipherment of hieroglyphics unlocked ancient Egyptian history
Cryptographers worked on decipherment of enemy communications constantly
Successful decipherment required linguistic and mathematical expertise
The manuscript's decipherment revealed lost historical accounts

definitions: conclusion or resolution reached after consideration of options or evidence
formal judgment or verdict pronounced by a court or authority
examples: The decision to expand internationally transformed the company
Making difficult decisions requires careful analysis and courage
The court's decision set an important legal precedent
The referee's decision cannot be appealed or overturned

definitions: flat floor surface on a ship extending from side to side
complete set of playing cards used for games
wooden platform attached to a house or building for outdoor use
examples: Passengers strolled along the ship's upper deck enjoying sunshine
The captain ordered all hands on deck immediately
She shuffled the deck before dealing cards to players
The magician used a marked deck for his tricks
We built a deck behind the house for barbecues
The wooden deck needs staining every two years

definitions: vehicle or structure having a specified number of levels or floors
examples: The double decker bus toured London's historic sites
We rode the upper level of the decker for views
The triple decker sandwich contained multiple meat layers
Old decker buses are popular tourist attractions worldwide

definitions: formal speech or recitation delivered with rhetorical force and dramatic gestures
examples: His passionate declamation moved the entire audience to tears
Students practiced declamation for the speech competition finals
The actor's declamation of Shakespeare resonated throughout the theater
Political declamation often employs emotional appeals effectively

definitions: formal or explicit statement, announcement, or proclamation of something important
official statement of taxable goods or income for customs or tax purposes
examples: The declaration of independence established a new nation
Her declaration of candidacy surprised political observers nationwide
Travelers must complete customs declaration forms accurately
The tax declaration showed all foreign income earned

definitions: player in bridge who plays both their own and dummy's cards
examples: The declarer must make nine tricks to fulfill contract
An experienced declarer reads opponents' cards through play
The declarer led from dummy's strong suit first
South became declarer after winning the bidding war

definitions: angular distance of a celestial object north or south of the celestial equator
formal or polite refusal of an invitation, offer, or nomination
examples: The star's declination helped astronomers locate it precisely
Magnetic declination varies depending on geographic location significantly
Her declination of the award surprised everyone present
The formal declination letter thanked them for consideration

definitions: gradual and continuous loss of strength, numbers, quality, or value over time
examples: The decline in manufacturing jobs affected entire communities
Population decline threatens rural towns with extinction
Mental decline often accompanies advanced age unfortunately
The empire's decline took centuries to complete
